[Life Salt](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1540)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Positive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=128" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 20</row>

**Price** 25 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Strike</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This crystal vial contains salts blessed by channeling life-giving energies into waters purified by holy fire. You can activate this vial by throwing it as a Strike. It's a simple [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195) ranged weapon with a range increment of 10 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn't add the [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) trait to the attack made with it. On a hit against an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160), life salt deals 1 [persistent positive damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), and the undead must succeed at a DC 20 Will save or be unable to attack you as long as it continues taking the persistent positive damage. If you use a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300) against any undead, this second effect ends, and the undead can attack you normally.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
